# Free-ranging Griffon Vultures and R!

## About Our Presenter

- [Kaija Gahm](https://kaijagahm.netlify.app/) is a third-year PhD candidate in Ecology & Evolutionary Biology at UCLA
<br><br>
- Her research focuses on how animals move through their habitat and interact with each other, using data from a free-ranging population of GPS-tracked vultures.
<br><br>
- Kaija has been using and teaching R for many years and is passionate about open science and reproducible methods
<br><br>
- She serves on the board of the Society for Open, Reliable, and Transparent Ecology & Evolutionary Biology (SORTEE), leads the "Hacky Hours" coding workspace at UCLA, and teaches workshops with The Carpentries
